meanings.definition: To come or occur as a consequence or result.
meanings.sent1: The rain will subvene after the dark clouds pass.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained that hard work will subvene success.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected guest's arrival subvened a lively conversation.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to study diligently subvened her academic achievements.
meanings.sent5: The seeds planted in the spring subvened a bountiful harvest in the fall.

meanings.definition: To provide financial assistance or support.
meanings.sent1: The kind neighbor offered to subvene the family in need.
meanings.sent2: The government program aims to subvene small businesses during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The generous donation will subvene the community center's renovation.
meanings.sent4: Her parents always subvene her education expenses.
meanings.sent5: The scholarship helped subvene his college tuition costs.

meanings.sent1: The mediator will subvene to resolve the dispute between the two parties.
meanings.sent2: It is important to subvene when conflicts arise to prevent escalation.
meanings.sent3: The wise advice from a friend can subvene in a difficult situation.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to subvene to stop the argument in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The referee will subvene if there is a foul during the game.
